greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = number of compositions of n into k parts such that no two cyclically adjacent parts are equal.
comment: See theorem 4 in Hadjicostas reference for generating function.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1275
P. Hadjicostas, Cyclic, dihedral and symmetric Carlitz compositions of a positive integer, Journal of Integer Sequences, 20 (2017), Article 17.8.5.
mathematica: max = 10; gf = Sum[x^(2*j)*y^2/(1 + x^j*y), {j, 1, max}] + Sum[x^j*y/(1 + x^j*y)^2, {j, 1, max}]/(1 - Sum[ x^j*y/(1 + x^j*y), {j, 1, max}]) + O[x]^(max+1) + O[y]^(max+1) // Normal // Expand;
Table[T[n, k], {n, 1, max}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 19 2018 *)
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Oct 12 2017
